meanings.definition: A type of stone used in construction.
meanings.sent1: The house was built using sturdy felstone.
meanings.sent2: The castle walls were made of felstone.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten tried to climb the felstone wall.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as solid as felstone.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the felstone made the structure strong.

meanings.definition: A type of stone with a yellowish hue.
meanings.sent1: The path was lined with beautiful felstone rocks.
meanings.sent2: The jewelry was adorned with sparkling felstone gems.
meanings.sent3: The artist painted the sunset with shades of felstone.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as felstone in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The warm glow of the felstone lit up the room.

meanings.definition: To felstone (verb): to build with felstone.
meanings.sent1: The skilled mason would felstone the walls of the cathedral.
meanings.sent2: The villagers decided to felstone a new bridge across the river.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to felstone a grand castle in the sandbox.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was built on a foundation as strong as felstone.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to felstone a memorial for their fallen heroes.
